description:
US oil giant Halliburton confirmed its computer systems were hit by a cyberattack that affected operations at its Houston offices.

The post Oil Giant Halliburton Confirms Cyber Incident, Details Scarce appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Oil Giant Halliburton Confirms Cyber Incident, Details Scarce

description:
Hackers gained access to the switch using valid administrator credentials, and then ‘jailbroke’ from the application level into the OS level.

The post China-Linked ‘Velvet Ant’ Hackers Exploited Zero-Day to Deploy Malware on Cisco Nexus Switches appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: China-Linked ‘Velvet Ant’ Hackers Exploited Zero-Day to Deploy Malware on Cisco Nexus Switches

description:
More than two years after the Log4j crisis, organizations are still being hit by crypto-currency miners and backdoor scripts.

The post Two Years On, Log4Shell Vulnerability Still Being Exploited to Deploy Malware appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Two Years On, Log4Shell Vulnerability Still Being Exploited to Deploy Malware

description:
Ransomware isn't just about malware. It's about brands, trust, and the shifting allegiances of cybercriminals.

The post Understanding the ‘Morphology’ of Ransomware: A Deeper Dive appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Understanding the ‘Morphology’ of Ransomware: A Deeper Dive

description:
Atlassian has released patches for nine high-severity vulnerabilities in Bamboo, Confluence, Crowd, and Jira products.

The post Atlassian Patches Vulnerabilities in Bamboo, Confluence, Crowd, Jira appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Atlassian Patches Vulnerabilities in Bamboo, Confluence, Crowd, Jira

description:
CISA warns that attackers are exploiting two critical-severity authentication bypass vulnerabilities impacting multiple Dahua products.

The post CISA Warns of Exploited Vulnerabilities Impacting Dahua Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: CISA Warns of Exploited Vulnerabilities Impacting Dahua Products

description:
CrowdStrike has denied having any significant acquisition talks with patch management firm Action1 following rumors of a $1 billion deal.

The post CrowdStrike Hits Back at Action1 Following $1 Billion Acquisition Rumors appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: CrowdStrike Hits Back at Action1 Following $1 Billion Acquisition Rumors

description:
A high-severity vulnerability in Cisco Unified CM and Unified CM SME could allow attackers to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

The post Cisco Patches High-Severity Vulnerability Reported by NSA appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Cisco Patches High-Severity Vulnerability Reported by NSA

description:
A critical vulnerability in the Litespeed Cache WordPress plugin can allow attackers to hack websites by creating an admin user.

The post Exploitation Expected for Flaw in Caching Plugin Installed on 5M WordPress Sites appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Exploitation Expected for Flaw in Caching Plugin Installed on 5M WordPress Sites

description:
Chrome 128 was released in the stable channel with patches for 38 vulnerabilities, including a V8 JavaScript engine flaw exploited in the wild.

The post Google Patches Sixth Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Google Patches Sixth Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2024
